00029 /***************************************************************************//**
00030  * Header file for reading and writing to the 25320 EEPROM used by the nRF9e5.
00031  *
00032  * References:
00033  *  - Atmel, AT25320 Datasheet.
00034  *  - Nordic, nRF9e5 Datasheet.
00035  *  - Tyndall 10mm nRF9E5 revA/B Schematic.
00036  *  - Tyndall 10mm Interface Board revB/C Schematic.
00037  *
00038  * @file nrf9e5.h
00039  * @date 24-Jan-2010
00040  * @author Se√°n Harte
00041  ******************************************************************************/
00042 
00043 
00044 #ifndef NRF9E5_H
00045 #define NRF9E5_H
00046 
00047 
00048 #define NRF_DEFAULT_CRYSTAL_FREQUENCY 20
00049 
00050 
00051 /**
00052  * Used to get details of the 25320 EEPROM, and initialise connection.
00053  *
00054  * @param freq frequency of crystal oscillator in Mhz (4, 8, 12, 16, or 20).
00055  * @return Pointer to structure containing description of memory, SPI pins and
00056  *     description in internal FT232R EEPROM.
00057  **/
00058 spiDeviceInfo_t* nrf_init(uint32_t freq);
00059 
00060 
00061 /**
00062  * Programs a number of bytes to the EEPROM. Header should be added before
00063  * calling this function: @see nrf_addEepromHeader().
00064  * @a address + @a size must be <= 4093.
00065  *
00066  * @param data pointer to bytes to write to memory.
00067  * @param address where to start writing to.
00068  * @param size number of bytes to write to the memory, other bytes will be 0.
00069  **/
00070 void nrf_write(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00071 
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Reads a number of bytes from the EEPROM.
00075  * @a address + @a size must be <= 4093.
00076  *
00077  * @param[out] data location to store read data.
00078  * @param address where to start reading from.
00079  * @param size how many bytes to read.
00080  **/
00081 void nrf_read(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00082 
00083 
00084 /** Writes 0xFF to every location in the EEPROM. **/
00085 void nrf_erase(void);
00086 
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * Adds 3 byte header to EEPROM data that is required by nRF9E5. Also adds CRC
00090  * and program size information which is needed for in-system programming. If
00091  * in-system programming is wanted, then this function also copies the
00092  * lower-half of the memory to the upper half.
00093  * @code
00094  *      byte[409-1]
00095  *         .
00096  *         .                = Unused
00097  *         .
00098  *      byte[(N+1)*256]
00099  *      byte[((N+1)*256)-1]
00100  *         .
00101  *         .                = Program data
00102  *         .
00103  *      byte[7]
00104  *      byte[6]             = High byte of program CRC
00105  *      byte[5]             = Low byte of program CRC
00106  *      byte[4]             = High byte of program size
00107  *      byte[3]             = Low byte of program size
00108  *      byte[2]             = How many 256 byte blocks are in the program (N)
00109  *      byte[1]             = Where program starts (7)
00110  *      byte[0]             = EEPROM configuration
00111  * @endcode
00112  *
00113  * @param[in,out] data program data.
00114  * @param rawCodeSize size of code being sent to function.
00115  * @param isSupportReprog if this is non-zero, then the data is copied to upper
00116  *      half of memory.
00117  **/
00118 void nrf_addHeader(uint8_t* data, uint32_t rawCodeSize, bool isSupportReprog);
00119 
00120 
00121 #endif
